title: TURN YOUR SMALL FARM INTO A BUSINESS! (AND SAVE BIG ON TAXES)

tasks.task: Starting a small garden business from a hobby
subtasks: Researching legal requirements for forming a business
Setting up LLC and obtaining necessary licenses and insurance
Managing finances and keeping business and personal accounts separate
Utilizing accounting software (e.g., FarmRays) for tax planning and record-keeping
Ensuring proper tax exemptions and deductions through strategic certifications
Expanding sales from local markets to wholesale with restaurants
Investing in necessary equipment (e.g., walk-in cooler) for product preservation
Adapting business practices for scalability and efficiency
Networking and staying informed to continuously improve the business

tasks.task: Scaling a gardening hobby into a profitable small farm
subtasks: Obtaining business licenses and insurance coverage
Integrating tax-exempt purchases and business funds
Transitioning from small-scale sales to wholesale distribution
Developing organized systems for finance and operations (e.g., QuickBooks, Square)
Implementing agronomic practices for high-volume crop production
Dealing with potential challenges and learning from experience
